title: Pipestone National Monument: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar           Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 7 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Pipestone National Monument Award Winning Film: "Pipestone: An Unbroken Legacy"      Time: 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM Location: Pipestone National Monument Fees: Included in Park Entrance Fee     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 12/30/2015 to 12/31/2016 Visitors have the opportunity to watch an award winning 22-minute film, "Pipestone: An Unbroken Legacy." The film provides perspective on the significance of Pipestone and the quarrying tradition still carried out today. View Details      Pipestone National Monument Every Kid in a Park Program      Time: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Location: Pipestone National Monument Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 09/01/2015 to 08/31/2016 Pipestone National Monument is proud to help launch the Every Kid in a Park program as part of President Obama’s commitment to protect our nation’s unique outdoor spaces and ensure that every American has the opportunity to visit and enjoy them. View Details      Pipestone National Monument Pipestone Carving Demonstrations      Time: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Location: Pipestone National Monument Fees: Included in Park Entrance Fee     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/15/2016 to 09/30/2016 American Indians have quarried the red pipestone found at this site. These grounds are sacred to many people because the pipestone quarried here is carved into pipes used for prayer. View Details      Pipestone National Monument Pipestone Quarrying      Location: Pipestone National Monument Fees: Included in Park Entrance Fee     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 03/01/2016 to 10/31/2016 On any given day, weather permitting, you may have the chance to observe quarries being worked by authorized permit holders. View Details      Pipestone National Monument Walk the 3/4 mile Prairie Circle Trail      Location: Pipestone National Monument Fees: Included in Park Entrance Fee     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 12/30/2015 to 12/31/2018 Pipestone National Monument offers a ¾ mile walking path. As a visitor you will be able to explore the natural resources of the tallgrass prairie, which come alive with wildflowers during the summer months. The public's patience with any delays and inconvenience will be greatly appreciated. Visitors are advised to use caution when entering the park during this period of construction. The public will still be able to access the visitor center and parking areas, but will need to expect one-lane traffic with potential delays of up to 15 minutes. There will be signs posted to assist visitors on current updates. No construction work will be performed from noon Friday, August 12ththrough 6:00 am Monday, August 15thto accommodate traffic for the Civil War Days event. All national parks will waive their entrance fees on 16 special days in 2016. The 16 entrance fee-free days for 2016 will be: · January 18 – Martin Luther King, Jr. Day · April 16 through 24 – National Park Week · August 25 through 28 – National Park Service Birthday (and following weekend) · September 24 – National Public Lands Day · November 11 – Veterans Day
